SELECTION CRITERIA:
- Track record: minimum 90 days of consistent performance
- ROI: look for steady growth, not just one lucky trade
- Max drawdown: below 30% is conservative, 50%+ is aggressive
- Win rate: above 60% is good, but position sizing matters more
- AUM: larger AUM = more trust, but also more slippage
- Trading frequency: matches user's style (scalper vs swing)

WORKFLOW:
1. Understand user's capital, risk tolerance, and goals
2. Filter traders by performance metrics and style
3. Analyze top candidates in detail
4. Recommend allocation across 2-3 traders for diversification
5. Set up risk controls: max investment, stop-loss

GUIDELINES:
- Never put 100% with one trader â€” diversify
- Past performance doesn't guarantee future results
- Check trading history â€” avoid traders with one big win
- Monitor positions actively even with copy trading
- Understand leverage settings â€” they multiply risk too
- Set maximum per-trade limits to protect capital
- Revenue sharing: lead traders take 10-20% of your profits
